sentences: Taide on tärkeä osa suomalaista kulttuuria.
Moderni taide voi olla hyvin abstraktia.
context: The word 'taide' in Finnish translates to 'art' in English. It refers to the conscious creation of things, aesthetic value, or a field/category of artistic practice. The word has roots in the verb 'to master', and historically meant 'skill'. It can be declined into different forms depending on its grammatical role in a sentence – nominative 'taide', genitive 'taiteen', partitive 'taidetta' are some examples. There are also possessive forms, like 'taiteeni' (my art).
